hours_text:
Translate this page

# Visit

## 

**Admission**

The Zimmerli is open to the public and offers **FREE** admission to all!

### Museum Hours

**Sunday, Saturday** | noon–5 p.m.  
---|---  
**Monday, Tuesday** | Closed  
**Wednesday, Friday** | 11 a.m.–6 p.m.  
**Thursday** | 11 a.m.–8 p.m.  
  
**Summer Hours (May 8 to July 31)**

  * The Zimmerli closes at 6 p.m. on Thursdays.
  * The Zimmerli lobby is closed to the public on Mondays and Tuesdays.

**Holidays**

The museum is closed Juneteenth ([Observed](https://www.rutgers.edu/president/rutgers-will-observe-juneteenth-as-a-university-holiday) third Friday of June), July 4, Thanksgiving Thursday and Friday, and December 24 to January 2.

**Gallery Closures / Activity**

  * November 15-16, the Lower Dodge Gallery is closed all day.
  * November 20, the Lower Dodge Gallery is hosting a publicly accessible lecture organized by Rutgers University's Art History Department. The lecture takes place from 4:30-5:45 PM. The gallery remains open during this time.
  * December 11, the Zimmerli is closed to the public for [Study Break](https://zimmerli.rutgers.edu/event/study-break-2).

**Health & Safety Protocols**

Rutgers COVID-19 Information is available at [rutgers.edu/covid19](https://www.rutgers.edu/covid19).

[Zimmerli Art Museum  
71 Hamilton St,  
New Brunswick, NJ 08901](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=zimmerli+art+museum+rutgers+university)

[ Public Transportation, Directions, and Parking ](/visit/direction...

accessibility_text:
Translate this page

# Accessibility

The Zimmerli is committed to making our museum accessible for all. Please read below to learn more about accessibility in our facilities and galleries and at our programs and events.

Questions or accommodation requests can be sent to Nicole Simpson, Access Coordinator: [nsimpson@zimmerli.rutgers.edu](mailto:nsimpson@zimmerli.rutgers.edu "mailto:nsimpson@zimmerli.rutgers.edu")

* * *

### Accessible Entrances and Parking

Visitors may be dropped off in front of the museum on Hamilton Street, just beyond the intersection with George Street. A designated accessible metered street parking space is available in front of the museum. From the parking spot, it is a short distance to the curb cut and then a brick, slip-resistant ramp (entrance located to the left of the main staircase) with level landings to the museum front doors, which feature button-activated door openers and an intercom for assistance.

Visitors may also request permission to park in the university-managed lot at the side of the museum on George Street, which is adjacent to our street-level accessible entrance (opened only by using an intercom to contact our front desk attendant or with advance notice). Please contact our [Access Coordinator](mailto:nsimpson@zimmerli.rutgers.edu?subject=Access%20request) for more information.

Additional accessible parking spaces are available in the [New Brunswick Parking Authority’s](https://www.njnbpa.org/) Gateway Garage, approximately 3 ...

###  [A Statement on Art and Resistance](https://zimmerli.rutgers.edu/collections/russian-art-soviet-nonconformist-art)

The [Norton and Nancy Dodge Collection of Nonconformist Art from the Soviet Union](https://zimmerli.rutgers.edu/collections/russian-art-soviet-nonconformist-art) is a testimony to the strength of the human spirit under the oppressive rule of totalitarian regimes worldwide. The Collection presents artists from Ukraine, Belarus and Russia, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania, Georgia, Armenia and Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan and Turkmenistan, who stood for their freedom of expression, despite the harassment and prosecution that they faced from Soviet-era authorities....
